item.title: 53pc ready to vote for BNP; 48pc seek Tarique as next PM, survey finds
item.description: Nearly 53 per cent of people are ready to vote for BNP candidates across the country, while more than 47 per cent want Tarique Rahman as the next prime minister, a survey released on Friday reveals. The survey titled “People’s Election Pulse Survey Round 3” was conducted jointly

item.title: Corrupt Mymensingh jail staff helped free murder suspects: RAB
item.description: The Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) says corrupt prison officials helped three murder suspects walk free from Mymensingh Central Jail without bail documents. RAB-14 Commander Naimul Hasan said the men were released with the assistance of “dishonest” jail staff. He made the remarks at a pr

item.title: Tarique urges voters to reaffirm Bogura as BNP bastion in election
item.description: Tarique Rahman has urged party activists to prove that Bogura remains a BNP stronghold by voting for the party’s “Sheaf of Paddy” symbol in the parliamentary elections. He addressed a roadside rally at Mokamtala Bus Stand in Shibganj Upazila around 3pm on Friday. Speaking at the

item.title: 10 hurt in BNP-NCP clash at Hatia
item.description: At least 10 people have been injured in clashes between activists of the BNP and the National Citizen Party (NCP) during the inauguration of a ferry service in Hatia, an island Upazila of Noakhali. The confrontation broke out at around 3:30pm on Friday at the Nalchira Ferry Terminal, centring on a

item.title: China to lift restrictions on UK lawmakers, PM Starmer says
item.description: China is set to lift restrictions which it had imposed on a group of British lawmakers, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Friday, meaning that they will now be free to travel to China. Starmer made the announcement during his four-day visit to China, the first by a UK leader in eight years, aime

item.title: Tarique pays tribute at July martyr Abu Sayed’s grave in Rangpur
item.description: BNP chief Tarique Rahman has paid his respects at the grave of Abu Sayed, the first martyr of the July 2024 mass uprising. Tarique began his party’s election campaign in Rangpur on Friday by visiting the grave in Pirganj Upazila's Babonpur village. He travelled to the village from Bogura aft

item.title: People to participate in election spontaneously: EC Sanaullah
item.description: Election Commissioner Abul Fazal Muhammad Sanaullah expressed optimism about the upcoming polls, saying he expects citizens to participate spontaneously and actively, reflecting the vibrancy of democracy. “There are only 12 days left for the election. I am very satisfied with the preparation

item.title: Arteta shrugs off title pressure ahead of Arsenal's trip to stubborn Leeds
item.description: Mikel Arteta is keen not to let Arsenal's three-match winless streak in the Premier League affect the players, calling for his team to stay grounded as they pursue their first English top-flight title since 2003-04. Sunday's home loss to Manchester United shaved Arsenal's lead at the top to four p

item.title: India-EU free trade deal may affect Bangladesh’s garment market: Report
item.description: India’s historic free trade agreement with the European Union (EU) is already reverberating across South Asia, with Bangladesh and Pakistan among the countries most immediately affected, bdnews24.com reports citing Zee News. The deal will eliminate or sharply reduce tariffs on over 90 percen

item.title: Shahjalal University student drowns in Sylhet’s Lalakhal
item.description: A student of Shahjalal University of Science and Technology (SUST) has died while bathing at Lalakhal, a tourist spot in Sylhet. The incident occurred on Friday afternoon at Lalakhal Zeropoint, according to Jaintapur Police chief Mohammad Mahbubur Rahman Molla. The drowned, identified as Musab Am

item.title: Rickshaw driver sent kidnapped child home after abducting him: RAB
item.description: A 3-year-old boy abducted outside Mugda Hospital in Dhaka was sent to his ancestral home in Gaibandha by the rickshaw driver who kidnapped him, the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) has said. Following reports of the abduction, the driver, identified as 41-year-old Chan Mia, was arrested at Wireless Ga

item.title: NCP vows ‘reform-oriented’ roadmap
item.description: The National Citizen Party (NCP) has announced a 36-point election manifesto aimed at constructing a “realistic and reform-oriented roadmap” before the February elections. According to the party, the manifesto builds upon its vision of “governance, principled policies, and reform
